title: Sagamore Spirit distillery to open April 21
text: Sagamore Spirit distillery to open April 21 Feb 22, 2017, 12:48pm EST Industries & Tags Joshua Gordon Reporter Baltimore Business Journal Share A rendering of the Sagamore Spirit campus in Port Covington. The campus will open to the… more Ayers Saint Gross Sagamore Spirit can be seen across Baltimore bars and restaurants, and starting April 21 fans of Under Armour CEO Kevin Plank 's whiskey will be able to get an up close look at where it's made. The Port Covington distillery at 301 E. Cromwell St. will open April 21 for free public tours and tastings of the Straight Rye Whiskey. Guests can learn about the process of making the whiskey, including bringing in water from Sagamore Farm, the Reisterstown horse farm also owned by Plank. A rendering of the Sagamore Spirit campus in Port Covington. The campus will open to the… more Ayers Saint Gross The 22,000-square-foot distillery building houses the production equipment, including a 6,000-gallon cooker and nine 6,500-gallon fermentors. Next door is a 27,000-square-foot welcome and processing center with two tasting rooms. The project also includes a two-story restaurant that will house a concept by James Beard Award-winning chef Andrew Carmellii of New York. Carmellini also is also establishing the concepts at Plank's Sagamore Pendry Baltimore hotel in Fells Point. “This is an exciting moment for Sagamore Spirit, and we are thrilled to share it with the city of Baltimore,” Sagamore Spirit President Brian Treacy said in a statement. “Our team will continue to work hard to restore Maryland’s distilling heritage, and put our state back on the map as the premier distiller of rye whiskey.” The first weekend of April 21-23 will offer distillery tours between 10 a.m.-6 p.m. with the last tour beginning at 5 p.m. Each tour can accommodate up to 24 people of all ages and will last about 45 minutes. Sagamore anticipates welcoming more than 100,000 visitors annually to the distillery. The campus is part of a larger 266-acre development of Port Covington by Plank's Sagamore Development Co. The Straight Rye Whiskey was released May 13 of last year and was featured at the Preakness Stakes and as part of a new whiskey club. Sagamore Spirit recently released a 112-proof cask-strength whiskey to go along with the original 83-proof whiskey. Joshua covers hospitality, tourism, casinos and sports business.
